title: Ode on a Grecian Urn — Ritual Map (URN-L01..URN-L50)

rite_lines.text: Thou still unravish'd bride of quietness,
rite_lines.rite_action: Consecrates the urn by direct address, turning reading into communion rather than observation.
rite_lines.world_effect: Creates a shared space where stillness counts as presence and intimacy can be non-consummated yet binding.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Opens the apostrophe channel that will carry the stanza’s interrogations.

rite_lines.text: Thou foster-child of silence and slow time,
rite_lines.rite_action: Installs silence and slow time as the governing liturgy—rules of tempo for the whole ceremony.
rite_lines.world_effect: Stabilizes an order where suspension is not decay but a shared discipline of attention.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Hands forward the urn’s kinship with time so “historian” can become credible.

rite_lines.text: Sylvan historian, who canst thus express
rite_lines.rite_action: Appoints the urn to an office of communal memory, making the artifact a public historian.
rite_lines.world_effect: Legitimizes a memory-world that does not require living witnesses to stay real.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Promises an ‘expression’ that will outrank ordinary speech.

rite_lines.text: A flowery tale more sweetly than our rhyme:
rite_lines.rite_action: Transfers authority from the poet’s voice to the urn’s form—medium becomes the trusted priest.
rite_lines.world_effect: Reorders trust: durability and shape become the grounds of shared belief.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Launches the hunt: if the urn speaks ‘sweeter,’ what legend is it holding?

rite_lines.text: What leaf-fring'd legend haunts about thy shape
rite_lines.rite_action: Initiates the question-procession, framing uncertainty as communal wonder rather than failure to decode.
rite_lines.world_effect: Creates a participatory world of partial evidence that demands shared inference.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Queues the cast-list to stabilize imagination (gods/mortals).

rite_lines.text: Of deities or mortals, or of both,
rite_lines.rite_action: Performs ritual taxonomy: classifies beings so the scene becomes socially legible.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains an ordered cosmos where categories hold even when facts are missing.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Anchors the rite in shared coordinates: named places as communal reference points.

rite_lines.text: In Tempe or the dales of Arcady?
rite_lines.rite_action: Maps the ceremony onto mythic geography—‘there’ becomes a communal ‘here’ for the reader-body.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces place as a shared cultural instrument, not a location to verify.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Escalates from place to identity: who is here, in this shared scene?

rite_lines.text: What men or gods are these? What maidens loth?
rite_lines.rite_action: Deepens the question-procession, binding the congregation through synchronized not-knowing.
rite_lines.world_effect: Repairs the reader’s need for certainty by sanctifying ambiguity as shared participation.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Introduces desire-with-resistance (‘loth’) to power the next dramatic engine.

rite_lines.text: What mad pursuit? What struggle to escape?
rite_lines.rite_action: Stages conflict as the ritual engine—pursuit/escape becomes the world’s pulse under stillness.
rite_lines.world_effect: Makes tension feel inevitable and communal: drama persists even when time is fixed.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Shifts from bodies to instruments, preparing the ‘unheard’ doctrine.

rite_lines.text: What pipes and timbrels? What wild ecstasy?
rite_lines.rite_action: Consecrates sound-objects that imply music without delivering it, priming shared imagination as liturgy.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains a world where absence (unheard music) is an active bond among readers.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Hands off to Chapel 2’s inversion: unheard becomes sweeter than heard.

rite_lines.text: Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard
rite_lines.rite_action: Inverts sensory authority, teaching the congregation that shared interior hearing outranks public sound.
rite_lines.world_effect: Rebuilds what counts as ‘real’ experience: the communal world is maintained through imagined audition.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Suspends the clause mid-gesture so the next line seals the preference.

rite_lines.text: Are sweeter; therefore, ye soft pipes, play on;
rite_lines.rite_action: Turns the instruments into ritual participants and issues a command that keeps the ceremony running.
rite_lines.world_effect: Creates continuity: the rite persists by command even when no literal sound can occur.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Directs the ‘how’ of listening: away from senses, toward spirit.

rite_lines.text: Not to the sensual ear, but, more endear'd,
rite_lines.rite_action: Reassigns the congregation’s listening organ—training attention as a social practice.
rite_lines.world_effect: Makes inwardness a shared norm; the community exists by agreeing where value resides.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Hands the ‘target’ of music to the next line: spirit-bound ditties.

rite_lines.text: Pipe to the spirit ditties of no tone:
rite_lines.rite_action: Defines an impossible music (no tone) as the ritual’s true hymn, binding the group through paradox.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces a world where meaning can be sustained without material delivery—shared belief becomes infrastructure.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Shifts focus from music to figures on the urn: fair youth and trees.

rite_lines.text: Fair youth, beneath the trees, thou canst not leave
rite_lines.rite_action: Pins a character into timeless placement, turning limitation into a ceremonial guarantee.
rite_lines.world_effect: Stabilizes the shared world by fixing roles and positions—community through permanence.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Carries the constraint forward: song continues, trees remain.

rite_lines.text: Thy song, nor ever can those trees be bare;
rite_lines.rite_action: Chants ‘nor ever’ as a durability clause, promising non-decay as communal comfort.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains an order where loss is suspended; the reader joins a society that rehearses continuity.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Hands off to the love-scene: the bold lover’s kiss.

rite_lines.text: Bold Lover, never, never canst thou kiss,
rite_lines.rite_action: Performs the ritual wound: desire is held at the threshold, made permanent by refusal.
rite_lines.world_effect: Repairs the fear of endings by substituting suspended fulfillment for consummation-and-loss.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Adds consolation logic: near the goal, do not grieve.

rite_lines.text: Though winning near the goal yet, do not grieve;
rite_lines.rite_action: Issues pastoral counsel that re-frames deprivation as a stable communal condition.
rite_lines.world_effect: Teaches the congregation a coping script: nearness can be enough when shared as doctrine.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Transfers consolation to the maiden: she cannot fade.

rite_lines.text: She cannot fade, though thou hast not thy bliss,
rite_lines.rite_action: Guarantees the beloved’s permanence as the ritual’s compensation for unfulfilled touch.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains the shared world by suspending decay, making beauty socially ‘safe’ from time.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Opens the chant-keyword: ‘For ever’ as seal and refrain.

rite_lines.text: For ever wilt thou love, and she be fair!
rite_lines.rite_action: Activates the forever-procession as chant; love becomes a public liturgy rather than a private event.
rite_lines.world_effect: Stabilizes society-in-time by repeating permanence as shared belief.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Hands into Chapel 3’s saturation chant (‘happy, happy’).

rite_lines.text: Ah, happy, happy boughs! that cannot shed
rite_lines.rite_action: Begins a communal chant by repetition; ‘happy’ works like a call-and-response to maintain mood.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces happiness as social atmosphere, not personal report—felt true because shared aloud.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Carries the non-decay clause forward: leaves cannot fall.

rite_lines.text: Your leaves, nor ever bid the Spring adieu;
rite_lines.rite_action: Extends the ‘nor ever’ spell to seasons, making renewal perpetual and communal.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains an order where farewell is suspended; community repairs grief by denying departure.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Transfers the chant from trees to musician: ‘happy melodist.’

rite_lines.text: And, happy melodist, unwearied,
rite_lines.rite_action: Blesses the performer with inexhaustion, turning labor into endless ritual service.
rite_lines.world_effect: Stabilizes the world by promising that the ceremonial worker never tires—continuity guaranteed.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Keys the refrain: ‘For ever piping…’

rite_lines.text: For ever piping songs for ever new;
rite_lines.rite_action: Runs the forever-procession at full volume: repetition becomes the mechanism of maintenance.
rite_lines.world_effect: Creates a paradoxical continuity: endless repetition that still feels new because it’s ritually renewed.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Moves the blessing to love itself—escalation chant.

rite_lines.text: More happy love! more happy, happy love!
rite_lines.rite_action: Intensifies the chant into a communal crescendo; emotion is socially manufactured by repetition.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces a shared emotional order that feels authoritative because it is collectively repeated.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Hands to the next line’s permanence clauses (‘for ever warm…’).

rite_lines.text: For ever warm and still to be enjoy'd,
rite_lines.rite_action: Defines desire as endlessly available and safe from cooling—ritual comfort through stability.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains a world where pleasure is unthreatened by change, creating communal reassurance.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Turns warmth into motion: panting, youth.

rite_lines.text: For ever panting, and for ever young;
rite_lines.rite_action: Chants bodily intensity without consequence, making vitality a public, repeatable condition.
rite_lines.world_effect: Sustains a shared fantasy of youth as social repair against aging and loss.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Sets up contrast: human passion vs. this elevated condition.

rite_lines.text: All breathing human passion far above,
rite_lines.rite_action: Draws a hierarchical boundary: the urn’s passion becomes a higher rite than ordinary human life.
rite_lines.world_effect: Reframes reality: the community is invited to live by an elevated model sustained through ritual reading.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Forces the cost to appear: what human passion leaves behind.

rite_lines.text: That leaves a heart high-sorrowful and cloy'd,
rite_lines.rite_action: Introduces the break-point: acknowledges satiation and sorrow as the human remainder.
rite_lines.world_effect: Repairs the ritual’s credibility by naming the pain it is trying to relieve.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Translates inner cost into bodily symptoms (forehead, tongue).

rite_lines.text: A burning forehead, and a parching tongue.
rite_lines.rite_action: Ends the chapel with embodied limit—marks the human body as the site of excess and finitude.
rite_lines.world_effect: Repairs community by admitting appetite’s scorch; the ritual offers the urn’s stillness as countermedicine.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Opens Chapel 4: the civic ritual of sacrifice and town.

rite_lines.text: Who are these coming to the sacrifice?
rite_lines.rite_action: Reactivates the question-procession, shifting from erotic rite to civic rite—community becomes visible as procession.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces society as an enacted gathering rather than a set of facts.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Opens the altar-node explicitly: green altar and priest.

rite_lines.text: To what green altar, O mysterious priest,
rite_lines.rite_action: Uses apostrophe to appoint a ritual mediator (priest) and locate the ceremony at an altar-station.
rite_lines.world_effect: Creates shared order by positing offices (priest) and stations (altar) as communal scaffolding.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Hands the action forward: leading the heifer.

rite_lines.text: Lead'st thou that heifer lowing at the skies,
rite_lines.rite_action: Animates sacrifice as ritual motion; sound (‘lowing’) reaches skyward, linking earth to cosmos.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces a world where communal action binds the vertical axis (earth/sky) without needing explanation.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Adds ornament and care: garlands, silken flanks.

rite_lines.text: And all her silken flanks with garlands drest?
rite_lines.rite_action: Marks the rite as aesthetic labor: decoration functions as public commitment and shared meaning.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains social cohesion by showing how communities invest beauty into obligation.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Turns from procession to the absent town that produced it.

rite_lines.text: What little town by river or sea shore,
rite_lines.rite_action: Invokes civic geography; the map-function returns to make community imaginable as place.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces a shared civic world by naming possible habitats rather than confirming one.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Expands possible forms: mountain-built, citadel.

rite_lines.text: Or mountain-built with peaceful citadel,
rite_lines.rite_action: Stabilizes community by supplying a protective form (citadel) and a mood (peaceful).
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains the idea of ordered life—society as defended and named.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Sets up the rupture: the town is emptied.

rite_lines.text: Is emptied of this folk, this pious morn?
rite_lines.rite_action: Performs absence as communal fact: emptiness becomes the evidence of shared ritual obligation.
rite_lines.world_effect: Transforms community into a negative space: society is maintained through what is missing.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Direct apostrophe to the town begins—town as addressed participant.

rite_lines.text: And, little town, thy streets for evermore
rite_lines.rite_action: Apostrophizes the town and locks it into the forever-procession; civic time becomes a chant.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains the shared order by freezing civic life into an eternal ritual present.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Hands to the silence clause: streets will be silent.

rite_lines.text: Will silent be; and not a soul to tell
rite_lines.rite_action: Stages the ritual break: testimony disappears; community must persist without narrators.
rite_lines.world_effect: Repairs meaning by making silence itself a binding medium when speech fails.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Completes the desolation logic: no one can return to explain why.

rite_lines.text: Why thou art desolate, can e'er return.
rite_lines.rite_action: Seals absence as irreversible; the ritual demands that the reader carry explanation as communal labor.
rite_lines.world_effect: Repairs community by transferring ‘telling’ to the congregation (readers) across time.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Opens Chapel 5: form praised, then the final seal is spoken.

rite_lines.text: O Attic shape! Fair attitude! with brede
rite_lines.rite_action: Begins the final chapel with praise-as-invocation; form itself becomes the ceremonial container of the world.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces social authority through aesthetic address: the community agrees to treat shape as meaningful.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Hands to the contents of the form: marble people overwrought.

rite_lines.text: Of marble men and maidens overwrought,
rite_lines.rite_action: Populates the stage with communal figures; the urn becomes a civic archive of bodies and roles.
rite_lines.world_effect: Makes society durable: people persist as forms when living testimony fails.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Extends population into environment: branches and weed.

rite_lines.text: With forest branches and the trodden weed;
rite_lines.rite_action: Restores ordinary ground under the ceremonial scene; nature and wear become shared texture.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains realism through ritual texture—common ground legitimizes the staged world.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Returns to apostrophe: ‘Thou, silent form…’

rite_lines.text: Thou, silent form, dost tease us out of thought
rite_lines.rite_action: Declares the ritual technique: silence is not lack but a device that reshapes communal cognition.
rite_lines.world_effect: Transforms the congregation’s mode of knowing: wonder replaces explanation as social glue.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Links the teasing power to eternity—time becomes the comparison.

rite_lines.text: As doth eternity: Cold Pastoral!
rite_lines.rite_action: Names the ambivalent affect (‘Cold’) while still consecrating the pastoral as a lasting ritual form.
rite_lines.world_effect: Repairs the ceremony by admitting chill/alienation inside the shared order rather than denying it.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Shifts to generational time: old age wastes this generation.

rite_lines.text: When old age shall this generation waste,
rite_lines.rite_action: Marks the inevitable rupture (aging) that threatens community, establishing the need for the urn’s endurance.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces historical time as shared threat, making the ritual’s promise socially necessary.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Sets up the counter-promise: ‘Thou shalt remain…’

rite_lines.text: Thou shalt remain, in midst of other woe
rite_lines.rite_action: Promises endurance amid changing sorrows; the urn becomes a persistent ceremonial anchor across eras.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains continuity of shared order by positing a stable form that outlives particular crises.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Introduces comparative suffering: woes beyond ours.

rite_lines.text: Than ours, a friend to man, to whom thou say'st,
rite_lines.rite_action: Assigns the urn a social role (friend) and a speech-act: it addresses humanity as an ongoing congregation.
rite_lines.world_effect: Produces a trans-generational community (‘man’) maintained by recurrent address.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Opens the benediction quotation—final formula begins.

rite_lines.text: "Beauty is truth, truth beauty,—that is all
rite_lines.rite_action: Utters the ritual seal: a compact doctrine that stabilizes shared knowing by tying aesthetic form to truth.
rite_lines.world_effect: Maintains communal order with an aphorism that can be repeated, taught, and inherited.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Completes the seal by limiting knowledge to what the rite authorizes.

rite_lines.text: Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know."
rite_lines.rite_action: Closes the ceremony by imposing epistemic limits; the community is repaired by a shared boundary on inquiry.
rite_lines.world_effect: Repairs anxiety by making ‘enough’ a communal agreement—reading becomes belonging.
rite_lines.continuity_hook: Final closure: the ritual ends with a benediction that can be reenacted in future readings.

diagram.ENTRY: Apostrophe consecrates Urn-as-Stage; stillness becomes presence.
diagram.CHANT: Question-procession piles interrogatives; wonder becomes shared order.
diagram.TURN: Desire/drama appears but is held inside marble time.
diagram.SEAL: Instruments imply music; absence becomes bond.

diagram.ENTRY: Heard/unheard inversion reassigns authority from senses to shared inwardness.
diagram.CHANT: Commands to pipes (‘play on’) keep the rite running.
diagram.TURN: The kiss cannot occur; deprivation becomes permanence.
diagram.SEAL: ‘For ever’ chant stabilizes love and beauty against time.

diagram.ENTRY: ‘Happy’ repetition manufactures communal mood as liturgy.
diagram.TURN: Human passion’s cost is named (cloy’d, sorrowful).
diagram.SEAL: Embodied limit (burning/parching) restores credibility and need for stillness.

diagram.ENTRY: Procession-to-sacrifice makes society visible as action.
diagram.CHANT: Apostrophe appoints priest/altar; offices and stations stabilize order.
diagram.TURN: The emptied town converts community into absence-in-time.
diagram.SEAL: Silence replaces testimony; readers inherit the duty to ‘tell.’

diagram.ENTRY: Praise consecrates form as container of shared world.
diagram.CHANT: Silent form ‘teases’ cognition; wonder becomes method.
diagram.TURN: ‘Cold Pastoral!’ admits ambivalence inside the rite.
diagram.SEAL: Aphorism binds beauty/truth and sets limits: communal ‘enough.’

M_CARD_DECK.play: shuffle within chapel; end each chapel by reading its SEAL lines aloud (C1 L10, C2 L20, C3 L30, C4 L40, C5 L50)

M_GRID.horizontal_traversal: altar resonance (jump across chapels via shared altar tags)
M_GRID.stations: highlight A_SILENCE/A_TIME/A_DESIRE/A_COMMUNITY/A_TRUTH nodes; clicking a node filters all linked lines

script: CALL: apostrophes (L01–L04, L12–L14, L32, L38, L41, L44)
CHANT: repetition (L20, L21–L27, L24, ‘for ever’ cluster)
M_MASS.rule: the congregation (readers) speaks CHANT lines together; solo-reader speaks CALL lines.

procession_detectors.PR_APOS: line begins with direct address (Thou/O/ye) or explicitly names addressee
procession_detectors.PR_Q: line contains interrogative form or stacked questions
procession_detectors.PR_FOREVER: line contains for ever / nor ever / for evermore repetitions

repair_logic_summary.how_it_breaks: The rite freezes fulfillment; human appetite is shown to scorch and cloy.
repair_logic_summary.repair_mechanism: Reframes lack as permanence and teaches a communal coping script (‘do not grieve’), then admits bodily limit to keep trust.

repair_logic_summary.how_it_breaks: No one can return to explain; meaning threatens to collapse.
repair_logic_summary.repair_mechanism: Transfers narration to the congregation across time: readers become the telling-function.

repair_logic_summary.how_it_breaks: The ritual’s comfort becomes chilling; distance is felt as coldness.
repair_logic_summary.repair_mechanism: Allows critique inside communion, then stabilizes with an aphoristic seal that sets epistemic limits (L49–L50).
